metadata.title: CVE-2021-23992 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Thunderbird did not check if the user ID associated with an OpenPGP key hasa valid self signature. An attacker may create a crafted version of anOpenPGP key, by either replacing the original user ID, or by adding anotheruser ID. If Thunderbird imports and accepts the crafted key, theThunderbird user may falsely conclude that the false user ID belongs to thecorrespondent. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.9.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23992` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
